intro: Aretiastrum azorelloides, commonly known as the Azorean grass, is a flowering plant native to the Azores. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, elongated leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with delicate, greenish-white flowers. It is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. Aretiastrum azorelloides plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native environment.
